meanings.definition: The state or quality of being the same in substance, character, or nature.
meanings.sent1: The samenesses of the twins made it difficult to tell them apart.
meanings.sent2: The samenesses between the two paintings were striking.
meanings.sent3: The samenesses in their outfits made them look like they planned to match.
meanings.sent4: The samenesses in their opinions led to a lack of diversity in the discussion.
meanings.sent5: The samenesses in their routines made their days predictable.

meanings.definition: The fact or condition of being identical or alike in every way.
meanings.sent1: The samenesses of the two snowflakes were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: The samenesses in their handwriting made it hard to distinguish between them.
meanings.sent3: The samenesses in their preferences for food made them the perfect dining companions.
meanings.sent4: The samenesses in their personalities were uncanny.
meanings.sent5: The samenesses in their voices made it difficult to tell who was speaking.
